competitions.title: UChicago Trading Competition
competitions.description: Trading competition hosted by the University of Chicago for teams of freshmen and sophmores.
competitions.requirements: Applicants must be undergraduate students currently enrolled in a college or university. Applicants must register in teams of three to four members, and at least one team member must be able to program in Python. The competition is restricted to freshmen and sophomores.

competitions.title: Harvard Trading Competition
competitions.description: Trading competition hosted by Harvard for any individual.
competitions.requirements: Programming skills, statistical analysis, market knowledge

competitions.title: Berkeley Trading Challenge
competitions.description: Trading competition hosted by Berkeley for any individual.
competitions.requirements: The event is open to all undergraduate and graduate students interested in quantitative trading. The event is targeted to students studying Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Physics, Economics, Finance, or related fields. We aim to spark interest in a wide range of quantitative strategies and trading skills as well as create a real-time trading environment for future quants and traders.

competitions.title: IMC Prosperity Trading Challenge
competitions.requirements: Prosperity is a 15-day global challenge hosted by IMC Trading. Teams are challenged to combine python skills, strategic insight and analytics to trade on a virtual market lead their island into prosperity.

competitions.title: Duke Fintech Trading Challenge
competitions.requirements: Each spring, students from institutions around the globe compete to grow electronic portfolios of US$1 million in simulated currency.
